meanings.definition: A defensive obstacle formed by felled trees with sharpened branches facing the enemy.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers quickly set up an abatis to protect their camp from intruders.
meanings.sent2: The abatis effectively blocked the path of the advancing enemy troops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the abatis was a fun maze to explore.
meanings.sent4: The abatis stood like a formidable wall of thorns against any approaching danger.
meanings.sent5: The image of the abatis bristling with sharp branches was etched in their minds as a symbol of defense.

meanings.definition: A fortification made of trees and branches laid in a row with the ends facing the enemy.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had an abatis surrounding its outer walls for added protection.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers strategically placed the abatis to hinder the enemy's advance.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the abatis was a giant caterpillar crawling towards them.
meanings.sent4: The abatis loomed like a forest barrier, daring anyone to try and breach it.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the abatis stretching across the battlefield was a testament to the ingenuity of defense tactics.
